project_abstract.cdata: The key objective of the Community Action Project is to focus on poverty reduction through: (a) completing the macroeconomic agenda or reform and private sector development in order to foster sustained growth; (b) strengthening rural development and natural resources management including the empowerment of local communities to manage economic and social development: and (c) promoting poverty reduction through human resources investments, effective social safety nets, improved targeting and regular monitoring of welfare indicators. The components include: (i) community sub-projects (including social mobilization, infrastructure, improved natural resources management, training and capacity building for local communities); (ii) poverty monitoring and analysis (technical assistance, study fund, survey enhancement, training and capacity-building, workshops, dissemination); and (iii) Community Action Project (CAP) institutional support (administration and operating costs, beneficiary assessments, Environmental Impact Assessment, training and capacity building for CAP staff).
